briefdescription.para: Enum describing transport type for LinphoneAddress.
Enum describing transport type for LinphoneAddress.
Object that represents a parsed SIP address.

detaileddescription.para: A SIP address is made of display name, username, domain name, port, and various uri headers (such as tags). It looks like 'Alice <sip:alice@example.net>'.
You can create an address using linphone_factory_create_address() or linphone_core_interpret_url_2() and both will return a NULL object if it doesn't match the grammar defined by the standard.
This object is used in almost every other major objects to identity people (including yourself) & servers.
The LinphoneAddress has methods to extract and manipulate all parts of the address.

briefdescription.para: Create a LinphoneAddress object by parsing the user supplied address, given as a string.

parameterdescription.para: String containing the user supplied address

simplesect.para: The create LinphoneAddress object

briefdescription.para: Constructs a LinphoneAddress object by parsing the user supplied address, given as a string.

simplesect.para: a LinphoneAddress if parsing is successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Clones a LinphoneAddress object.

simplesect.para: a new LinphoneAddress object.

briefdescription.para: Increment reference count of LinphoneAddress object.

simplesect.para: the same LinphoneAddress object.

briefdescription.para: Decrement reference count of LinphoneAddress object.

detaileddescription.para:
When dropped to zero, memory is freed.
address
a LinphoneAddress object.

briefdescription.para: Returns if address is valid.

simplesect.para: the scheme if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the address scheme, normally "sip".

simplesect.para: the scheme if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the display name.

simplesect.para: the display name if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the display name.
Returns the username.

simplesect.para: the username name if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the username.
Returns the domain name.

simplesect.para: the domain name if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the domain.
Get port number as an integer value, 0 if not present.

simplesect.para: the port set in the address or 0 if not present.

briefdescription.para: Sets the port number.

parameterdescription.para: the port to set in the address

briefdescription.para: Get the transport.

simplesect.para: a LinphoneTransportType, default value if not set is UDP.

briefdescription.para: Set a transport.
Returns whether the address refers to a secure location (sips) or not.

simplesect.para: TRUE if address refers to a secure location, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: Make the address refer to a secure location (sips scheme)

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if address is requested to be secure.

briefdescription.para: returns whether the address is a routable SIP address or not

simplesect.para: TRUE if it is a routable SIP address, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the value of the method parameter.

simplesect.para: the value of the parameter or NULL.

briefdescription.para: Set the value of the method parameter.

parameterdescription.para: the value to set to the method parameter.

briefdescription.para: Get the password encoded in the address.

detaileddescription.para:
It is used for basic authentication (not recommended).
address
a LinphoneAddress object.
the password if any, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the password encoded in the address.

detaileddescription.para:
It is used for basic authentication (not recommended).
address
a LinphoneAddress object.
password
the password to set.

briefdescription.para: Removes address's tags and uri headers so that it is displayable to the user.
Returns the address as a string.

detaileddescription.para:
The returned char * must be freed by the application. Use ms_free().
address
a LinphoneAddress object.
a string representation of the address.

briefdescription.para: Returns the SIP uri only as a string, that is display name is removed.

detaileddescription.para:
The returned char * must be freed by the application. Use ms_free().
address
a LinphoneAddress object.
a string representation of the address.

briefdescription.para: Compare two LinphoneAddress ignoring tags and headers, basically just domain, username, and port.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling if the LinphoneAddress objects are equal.

briefdescription.para: Compare two LinphoneAddress taking the tags and headers into account.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling if the LinphoneAddress objects are equal.

briefdescription.para: Get the header encoded in the address.

simplesect.para: the header value or NULL if it doesn't exists.

briefdescription.para: Set a header into the address.

detaileddescription.para:
Headers appear in the URI with '?', such as <sip:test@linphone.org?SomeHeader=SomeValue>.
address
a LinphoneAddress object.
header_name
the header name.
header_value
the header value.

briefdescription.para: Tell whether a parameter is present in the address.

simplesect.para: A boolean value telling whether the parameter is present in the address

briefdescription.para: Get the value of a parameter of the address.

simplesect.para: The value of the parameter or NULL if it doesn't exists.

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a parameter of the address.

parameterdescription.para: The new value of the parameter.

briefdescription.para: Tell whether a parameter is present in the URI of the address.

simplesect.para: A boolean value telling whether the parameter is present in the URI of the address

briefdescription.para: Get the value of a parameter of the URI of the address.

simplesect.para: The value of the parameter or NULL if it doesn't exists.

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a parameter of the URI of the address.

parameterdescription.para: The new value of the parameter.

briefdescription.para: Set the value of the parameters of the URI of the address.
Removes the value of a parameter of the URI of the address.
Destroys a LinphoneAddress object (actually calls linphone_address_unref()).

SIP address parser API.

detaileddescription.para: This api is useful for manipulating SIP addresses ('from' or 'to' headers).
